Description: Two fragments of different Egyptian or Egyptianizing glazed composition (faience) 'common bowl'; hemispherical bodies with incurving rims; mould-made or -pressed and covered with a blue glaze and brown painted decoration; (1) larger frahment has, on interior, a bird (duck?) with outstretched wings against a background of lotus flowers (2) the second fragment preserves traces of a frieze of cross-hatch or net pattern below the interior rim, dots on the rim. NB: previously reported as joining fragments of the same vessel, which is incorrect, as sherds are of different width and fabric.
Bibliographic references: Malmgren 2003 / Klavdhia-Tremithos. A Middle and Late Cypriote Bronze Age site. (no. 151, p.56)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 189)
Kiely 2011d / Klavdia-Tremithos: A Bronze Age community in south-east Cyprus (M.7)
